definitions.definition: bend (something flexible and relatively flat) over on itself so that one part of it covers another.
examples: she folded all her clothes and packed all her bags

definitions.definition: mix an ingredient gently with (another ingredient), especially by lifting a mixture with a spoon so as to enclose it without stirring or beating.
examples: fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture
synonyms: incorporate "fold the cream into the chocolate mixture"

definitions.definition: (of a piece of furniture or equipment) be able to be bent or rearranged into a flatter or more compact shape, typically in order to make it easier to store or carry.
bend or rearrange (a piece of folding furniture or equipment).
be able to be opened out; unfold.
cause (rock strata) to undergo bending or curvature.
examples: a more active period of igneous activity caused intense folding

definitions.definition: cover or wrap something in (a soft or flexible material).
examples: a plastic bag was folded around the book

definitions.definition: hold or clasp (someone) closely in one's arms with passion or deep affection.
examples: Bob folded her in his arms and kissed her
synonyms: cradle "he folded her in his arms"

definitions.definition: (of an enterprise or organization) cease operating as a result of financial problems or a lack of support.
examples: the club folded earlier this year
synonyms: go belly up "the firm folded last year"

definitions.definition: (especially of a sports player or team) suddenly stop performing well or effectively.
examples: he folded in the second round

definitions.definition: (of a poker player) drop out of a hand.
examples: an unerring knack for knowing when to fold and when to stay in
